section.section: The Board, with the approval of the Secretary, may appoint a qualified inspector to act as its agent and make inspections throughout the State.

The inspector is entitled to:
A salary in accordance with the State budget; and
Reimbursement for expenses under the Standard State Travel Regulations, as provided in the State budget.

The Board may designate officers of county humane societies, societies for the prevention of cruelty to animals, or licensed veterinarians to:
Act as its agent; and
Make routine inspections.

An inspector designated under paragraph (1) of this subsection:
May not receive compensation; but
Is entitled to reimbursement for expenses under the Standard State Travel Regulations, as provided in the State budget.
